title: DEA data collected on Transportation Interdiction Program

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All data prepared or collected for the DEA Office of the Administrator's internal review of the Transportation Interdiction Program (TIP). The review was launched in November of 2024, and the results were summarized in a Jan. 8 memo from the DEA administrator:  https://ij.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Transportation-Interdiction-Program-Memorandum-1.8.25.pdf

In that memo, the administrator wrote: "Our comprehensive internal review looked at data from across the agency, including drug and money seizures and arrests at mass transportation facilities." I am therefore requesting this data.

Please note that the Freedom of Information Act's deliberative process privilege does not protect material that is “purely factual." Nat’l Wildlife Fed’n v. U.S. Forest Serv., 861 F.2d 1114, 1122 (9th Cir. 1988).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bible GEO Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A .csv file containing metadata of all emails sent or received by email address(es) former ICE official Daniel Bible used for official government business during the period beginning January 1, 2024, and continuing through November 6, 2024, containing the domain "@geogroup.com" in the To, From, CC, or BCC lines. The .csv file metadata should contain the sender, recipient(s), date sent, time sent, date received, time received, email subject line, attachment name(s), attachment file size(s), priority status, and read receipt status. 

I make this request as a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and accordingly, request a fee waiver. 

I request expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and in support thereof, I make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746: 
1. A January 17, 2025, report from the Project on Government Oversight revealed former ICE official Daniel Bible notified ICE Ethics of his intent to transition from employment for ICE to employment for ICE's leading detention contractor, The GEO Group, in November 2024. See https://www.pogo.org/investigations/private-prison-giant-hired-ice-detention-chief. 

2. The end of Mr. Bible's federal employment with ICE, if it occurred, will have been less than one year before the beginning of his planned employment with The GEO Group, if it occurred.

3. Federal law prohibits certain government officials from working for contractors within one year after they leave federal government under certain circumstances. 

4. GEO previously violated this federal prohibition by hiring former ICE official Tracey Valerio as purported expert in litigation. See: https://www.thedailybeast.com/ex-ice-official-paid-to-defend-dollar1-a-day-wages-for-immigrants/. 

5. ICE Ethics imposed no publicly acknowledged penalty against GEO for violating this revolving-door provision. 

6. ICE has unlawfully refused to provide records regarding Ms. Valerio's tenure at ICE for the past six years: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/tracey-valerio-immigration-and-customs-enforcement-72985/#file-1037660. 

7. Similarly, former ICE custody management director and acting ICE director Tae Johnson sought and obtained employment with GEO, which began less than one year after his departure from the agency. https://www.geogroup.com/media/5twe5h5c/4ee9aaae-a38b-4f10-83eb-97c0f8f0c503.pdf. 

8. ICE has unlawfully refused to provide records regarding Mr. Johnson's tenure at ICE for the past 19 months. https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/tae-johnson-death-emails-145670/. 

9. ICE medical officials have repeatedly concluded GEO's failure to comply with the standards set forth in ICE contracts and its own policies have contributed to or caused the deaths in federal custody at or following their detention in GEO facilities. 

10. ICE continues to contract with GEO, and is poised to enter into additional detention contracts with the company worth billions of dollars over the next several years. 

11. The public and policymakers will not have the information to evaluate the efficacy and lawfulness of these contractual arrangements if ICE continues to withhold responsive records for years. 

12. There is an urgent need to inform the public about this actual or alleged government misconduct. 

13. GEO's profitability and increased detention opportunities have been the subject of widespread media attention. See, e.g., 
a. https://www.npr.org/2025/01/16/nx-s1-5218641/immigrant-detention-trump-deportation-plans
b. https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/migrants-minimum-wage-20039275.php
c. https://www.axios.com/2025/01/15/ice-detention-expansion-biden-trump-deportation
d. https://www.forbes.com/sites/michellembekeani/2025/01/12/will-mass-deportation-be-a-moneymaker-for-private-prisons/
e. https://calmatters.org/politics/capitol/2024/07/detainees-immigrants-labor-rights/
f. https://www.opensecrets.org/news/2024/07/private-prison-giant-geo-group-ramps-up-lobbying-on-immigrant-surveillance/
g. https://www.capradio.org/articles/2024/12/09/ice-is-looking-for-a-new-detention-center-in-blue-california-the-state-probably-cant-stop-it/
f. https://prismreports.org/2024/06/25/nearly-all-deaths-in-ice-detention-over-5-years-were-preventable/
g. https://prismreports.org/2024/04/01/ice-cruelty-kills-another-migrant-solitary-confinement/
h. https://newjerseymonitor.com/2024/04/19/private-prison-company-eyes-newark-site-for-new-ice-jail/
i. https://sherwood.news/markets/geo-group-ice-immigration-contractor-trump-election-bump/
j. https://www.vvdailypress.com/story/news/2024/10/22/adelanto-immigration-customs-enforcement-ice-detention-center-to-remain-open-california/75780811007/
k. https://arkansasadvocate.com/2024/08/01/private-prison-giant-geo-group-ramps-up-lobbying-on-immigrant-surveillance/


Please grant expedited processing of this request and comply with the statutory provisions of the Freedom of Information Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (CDOT)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All texts and emails sent or received by current Commissioner of the Chicago Department of Transportation (CDOT) Thomas (Tom) Carney from December 1, 2023 to September 1, 2024 that contain any of the following keywords or phrases: Gaza, Palestine, Israel, March on the DNC, March on the DNC 2024, U.S. Palestinian Community Network, USPCN, Bodies Outside of Unjust Laws, Coalition to March, Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, CAARPR, sight and sound, sight & sound, genocide, protest. 

For any potentially responsive documents, please send full the conversation history and any attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

communications.subject: Re: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (CDOT)

All communications and updates will come from the Records Center.

Thank you.

CDOT Freedom of Information staff

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Keith Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into filmmaker David Keith Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/16/movies/david-lynch-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Luigi Mangione December 19, 2024 transportation budget
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Data showing the budget of all costs associated with the widely publicized December 19, 2024 "perp walk" of Luigi Mangione upon entering New York City following extradition from Pennsylvania, including but not limited to:
- The cost of transportation via helicopter;
- The cost in man hours of all members of the security team assigned to walk with Mangione;
- An inventory and cost of all weapons used during the walk from the helicopter pad to the building;
- Any additional security detail costs associated with the presence of New York Mayor Eric Adams;
- Any other security or logistical costs related to the transportation of Luigi Mangione into NYCPD custody.

I am a lawyer and journalist and intend to use this information for educational purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebekah Rini, Esq.

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Crime Data Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Offense Level Data
Please provide offense level data for incidents occurring within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Incident number, Occurrence date, Occurrence time, Reported date, Reported time, Offense description, UCR/NIBRS code, Other offense code/statutes (where applicable), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business/location name if available, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

2. CFS Level Data
Please provide call-for-service (CFS) data for calls within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Call number, Call date, Call time, Call type (if coded, please include code definitions), Call type description (if coded, please include code definitions), Disposition (No Action Taken, Gone Upon Arrival, etc.), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business name (where applicable), Beat, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karli DeBlois

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Crime Data Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Offense Level Data
Please provide offense level data for incidents occurring within a one-mile radius 599 East Jule Peek Ave, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Incident number, Occurrence date, Occurrence time, Reported date, Reported time, Offense description, UCR/NIBRS code, Other offense code/statutes (where applicable), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business/location name if available, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

2. CFS Level Data
Please provide call-for-service (CFS) data for calls within a one-mile radius of 599 East Jule Peek Ave, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Call number, Call date, Call time, Call type (if coded, please include code definitions), Call type description (if coded, please include code definitions), Disposition (No Action Taken, Gone Upon Arrival, etc.), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business name (where applicable), Beat, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karli DeBlois

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2025-056-01905 Submitted to New York City Police Department (NYPD)
communications.communication:
Your request FOIL-2025-056-01905 has been successfully submitted to the New York City Police Department (NYPD).
                                The details of your request are shown below. 
 
Request Title: Luigi Mangione Perp Walk Budget 
 
Request Description: Other Request 
 
Request Type: Other Request 
 
 Other Request 
Type of Request: 
Report #: 
Date: 
Time: 
Precinct: 
Location: 
Description:
                                            
                                                To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Data showing the budget of all costs associated with the widely publicized December 19, 2024 "perp walk" of Luigi Mangione upon entering New York City following extradition from Pennsylvania, including but not limited to:
- The cost of transportation via helicopter;
- The cost in man hours of all members of the security team assigned to walk with Mangione;
- An inventory and cost of all weapons used during the walk from the helicopter pad to the building;
- Any additional security detail costs associated with the presence of New York Mayor Eric Adams;
- Any other security or logistical costs related to the transportation of Luigi Mangione into NYCPD custody.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Miami-Dade police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

As to you first request: While we maintain a Brady list, our list consists of pending investigations known to the officers as well as the pending charges against the officers, which are considered Brady by law.  See attached.
As to your second request: We do not track such information, as such we have no responsive public records.
Lastly, as an aside, unlike other jurisdictions, in Florida pursuant to Chapter 119, F.S., closed police disciplinary investigative files are a matter of public record and are available from individual employing police agencies.

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Public Disclosure Request :: P018115-011625
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon Bergin: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of King County Prosecuting Attorney. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this system on 1/16/2025 and given the reference number P018115-011625 for tracking purposes. Our regular business hours are Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM Pacific Time. If your request is submitted outside our regular business hours then your request will be received in our office the next business day. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fking-county-prosecuting-attorney-17650%252Fking-county-police-disciplinary-files-179899%252F%253Femail%253Dkingcountyprosecutor%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABbgy5ZyfrmdgCNqBAVCw7S0vc%3A1tYd8W%3A9fDpatmoaNdPDy8wa27-aLZTE80JM2LRbz5LGevNowo 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant division(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Disclosure System. 
King County Prosecuting Attorney

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Suffolk County police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin
